Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a rectangular body with three wick-holes along the front edge, and one projecting nozzle on each short side. At the rear is a leaf-shaped handle. The sunken top is plain; there is a rim around the filling-hole. The rectangular raised base is sunken within. Brown, micaceous clay, covered with a dark brown slip.
Curator's comments: Close: Kaufmann, C., 1913. ‘Ägyptische terrakotten der griechisch-römischen und koptischen epoche vorzugsweise aus der oase El Faijûm (Frankfurter sammlung)’. Cairo : F. Diemer, Finck & Baylaender succ., fig. 128; Gayet, A.J., 1904. ‘Fantômes d’Antinoë. Les sépultures de Leukyoné et Myrithis’. Paris : Société française d'éditions d'art, p. 48, from the tomb of Myrithis (but with seven nozzles). Lamps of the second or third Century AD, like 1874,0314.19 (BM 48544) and 1925,1120.42, were also found in this tomb.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1973)
